hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Crush in Memecoins (PEPE, DOGE)
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a >50% intraday price spike in a memecoin (PEPE, DOGE) on high volume (>5x 20-day avg) driven by identifiable news/social media hype, a short volatility position entered after the initial surge fades will profit as implied volatility collapses faster than realized volatility over the next 36 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Memecoin rallies fueled by hype are notoriously ephemeral. Options/futures markets often overprice volatility persistence. The 'fading spike' entry avoids catching the initial momentum and targets the volatility decay phase. This works best in Bull/Neutral regimes where panic selling is less likely.
entry_conditions: Intraday price spike >50% from previous day's close
Volume on spike day >5x 20-day average volume
Clear catalyst identified (major influencer tweet, exchange listing rumor)
Entry: After the first 4-hour candle closes below its open following the peak of the spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Asset's 24-hour realized volatility drops below its 7-day average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the high of the initial spike candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains elevated or increases further after entry in >50% of cases, or the price spike resumes and hits the stop-loss frequently, indicating a sustained shift in valuation rather than a transient pump.
